enhanced_by.reason: Both methods involve cleaning up and removing listeners, which is a common setup for shutdown operations.
Both methods involve canceling transactions, which is a necessary step during shutdown to ensure no lingering operations.
This method should be invoked before shutting down to ensure all client transactions are properly removed and cleaned up.
This method should be invoked before shutting down to ensure all server transactions are properly removed and cleaned up.
The NetAccessManager should be stopped before shutting down the StunStack to ensure all network resources are properly released.
